value.title: Azure Partner Zone brings new resources and special events for Partners
value.excerpt: In addition to the new web experience for Azure Partners, engineering and marketing teams across Azure will be hosting special events for partners, designed to help build, scale, and secure your Azure practice.

value.title: NAB to share development costs with Microsoft as it sends 1,000 apps to Azure

value.title: New Azure SQL Database gateways in Australia East, Canada Central, and West US 2
value.excerpt: New Azure SQL Database gateways are being added to Australia East, Canada Central, and West US 2 regions and will start accepting traffic on August 10, 2020.

value.title: Azure Files support and new updates in advanced threat protection for Azure Storage
value.excerpt: A year ago we announced the general availability of advanced threat protection for Azure Storage, to help our customers better protect their data in blob containers from the growing risk of cyberattacks.

value.title: Office 365 backup to object storage: AWS S3 and Azure Blob
value.excerpt: This 8-minute demo of Veeam® Backup for Microsoft Office 365 will show how to eliminate the risk of losing access and control over your Office 365 data including Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business and Microsoft Teams.

value.title: Distributed network name for SQL Server on Virtual Machines is now available
value.excerpt: Support for distributed network name (DNN) for SQL Server failover cluster instance (SQL FCI) on Azure IaaS with SQL Server 2019 CU2 and higher is now available.

value.title: Simplify and modernize your Java and Spring workloads with Azure Service Bus
value.excerpt: Seamlessly lift and shift your Java and Spring workloads to Azure while also modernizing your application stack to take full advantage of the benefits of cloud computing. Azure Service Bus Premium tier now has feature parity with Java Message Service 2.0 over Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (in preview).

value.title: Azure Load Balancer support for IP-based backend pool management is in preview
value.excerpt: Azure Load Balancer now supports adding and removing resources from a backend pool via an IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and virtual network ID. value.title: Australian government to move to Azure-based records management
value.excerpt: Australian government entities will soon see records held in the cloud, thanks to an initiative led by the Digital Transformation Agency (DTA) to modernise digital records management in the public sector.
